title: Blind-contour portraits
desc: Sit facing each other with sketchpads. Set a 5-minute timer. Keep your eyes on your partner's face and draw one continuous line without glancing down. When the timer ends, share one detail you enjoyed capturing before showing the portraits.

title: 100-word micro-story
desc: Write exactly 100 words about today.

title: Four-panel comic
desc: Sketch today in four frames.

title: Blackout poetry
desc: Use an old flyer or mailer to reveal a poem.

title: Collage from junk mail
desc: Cut and tape scraps into a tiny scene or creature.

title: Paint with coffee or tea
desc: Brew a little and paint washes or lettering.

title: Tonight poem
desc: Write a 10-line poem where each line starts with ‘Tonight…’.

title: Origami crane or box
desc: Fold paper into a crane or lidded box, then gift it.

title: Doodle swap
desc: One person starts a doodle; the other finishes it.

title: Tiny recyclables build
desc: Create a mini robot, vehicle, or creature from scraps.

title: Charades
desc: Use the Charades prompt button below to draw a surprise idea and act it out silently.

title: 20 questions with a maybe
desc: Yes/No only—with one ‘maybe’ allowed.

title: Household pictionary
desc: Grab random objects to inspire quick sketches.

title: Two-truths-and-a-wish
desc: Swap a lie for a wish you have.

title: Story baton
desc: Tell a story together one sentence at a time.

title: Blanket-fort speed build
desc: Construct a cozy fort, then sit inside for two minutes.

title: Scavenger hunt
desc: Find 5 blue things or 3 circles around the room.

title: Appreciation sprint
desc: Each write five specific appreciations, then read aloud.

title: Back-to-back drawing
desc: One describes shapes; the other draws without peeking.

title: Rose, bud, thorn
desc: Take turns sharing one highlight, one budding thing, and one tough moment.

title: Massage swap
desc: Check consent, then trade hand or shoulder massages.

title: Seven-minute question trade
desc:
Set a seven-minute timer. Person A asks:
• What's something new you noticed today?
• Which tiny risk are you excited to try soon?
• When did you feel most connected this week?
Person B asks:
• Which small comfort is calling you right now?
• What's a question you'd love me to ask more often?
• What felt surprisingly fun today?
Switch who asks first next round.

title: Wish & appreciate exchange
desc: Each share one wish and one appreciation before swapping.

title: Stretch follow-the-leader
desc: Mirror gentle stretches led by one person, then swap.

title: Hallway bowling
desc: Use bottles as pins and rolled socks as the ball.

title: Living-room dance party
desc: Make your own rhythm—no music required.

title: Plank and pun duel
desc: Hold a plank while your partner tells groan-worthy puns.

title: Balance trail
desc: Lay a tape or scarf tightrope and take turns walking it.

title: Tidy-dance sprint
desc: Move objects back home while swaying to a silent beat.

title: Tea ceremony
desc: Brew, pour slowly, and describe the flavors you notice.

title: 5-4-3-2-1 grounding
desc: Notice 5 sights, 4 touches, 3 sounds, 2 smells, 1 taste.

title: Body scan with self-massage
desc: Slowly scan from head to toes, noticing sensations while gently massaging temples, jaw, shoulders, hands, and feet.

title: Rearrange a surface
desc: Style one shelf or tabletop to feel pleasing.

title: Draw your breathing
desc: Without looking at the page, let your pen wander a wavy line that rises on inhales and falls on exhales. Peek after a minute and add tiny marks for any pauses or sighs you noticed.

title: Home words candle ritual
desc: Light a candle and write 10 words that feel like home.

title: Teach a tiny skill
desc: Demo a knot, card shuffle, or another micro-skill.

title: Create 5 shared gestures
desc: Sit together and invent five simple hand gestures for feelings you want to remember tonight. Agree on what each one means, practice them back and forth, and try using them later for quick check-ins.

title: Read one poem aloud
desc: Underline one line and share why it stands out.

title: Map your home from memory
desc: Sketch a top-down map, then compare versions.

title: Mini floor-plan rethink
desc: Sketch a room and plan one small move.

title: Question storm
desc: List 10 things you’re curious to look up later.

title: Label the cable tangle
desc: Make three labels from tape or paper and tag cords.

title: Water-and-prune round
desc: Water plants and remove one tired leaf per plant.
need: Need for all living things to flourish

title: Five-item donate pile
desc: Gather five things to donate right now.

title: Mend or shine one thing
desc: Sew a button, tidy a seam, or polish a mirror.

title: House micro-wins list
desc: List quick wins for the house and check one off immediately.

title: Spice blending lab
desc: Open three spices, mix a pinch, and name the blend.

title: Blindfold taste test
desc: Try three safe foods and describe textures before guessing.

title: Ice-cube experiment
desc: Hold an ice cube for 10 seconds, then journal sensations.

title: Indoor smell walk
desc: Each person gathers five distinct smells and lines them up from comforting to zesty. Trade trays, explore each other's picks, then rearrange them to show how you'd order your partner's selection.

title: 3×3 gratitude
desc: Name 3 things about me, 3 about you, and 3 about our space.

title: Needs check-in
desc: Each name two needs alive right now, then choose a fitting idea.

title: Love note hideaway
desc: Write a love note and hide it at eye level for later.

title: Weather report doodles
desc: Draw today as weather icons and compare forecasts.

title: One small promise
desc: Write a promise for tomorrow and take a 30-second first step now.
